markdown:
Ministers of tumult are grandmasters of killing, having cultivated their prowess to supernatural levels through the qi reaved from countless mortals. Many such jiang-shi ministers rule over settlements or even entire city-states, cowing their subjects into unerring obedience. A settlement or city-state under the control of a minister of tumult typically seems, on the outside, like everything is running smoothly and with clockwork precision. Guard patrols, street cleanings, carriages, and more always arrive precisely at the designated time, neither early nor late. To a visitor who doesn't pay any heed to the unease behind the smiles on the inhabitants' faces, the minister of tumult's fiefdom might appear to be a marvelous place to live. But the truth is much more dire. Ministers of tumult keep control and engorge themselves with qi by draining qi from criminals. If the minister of tumult is hungry and there haven't been any serious crimes, they simply dole out this punishment for petty crimes, minor infractions, or simple failures to perform adequately. This keeps the people in check, as there always seems to be a way to avoid the penalty by acting perfectly. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 32 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27 [Minister Of Tumult](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1910) **Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 159, [Pathfinder #167: Ready? Fight!](/Sources.aspx?ID=86) pg. 87 **Perception** +28; breathsense (precise) 60 feet, [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20), [Tien](/Languages.aspx?ID=43) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +24, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +29, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +24, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +24, [Martial Arts Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +22, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +20, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +24 **Str** +7 **Dex** +4 **Con** +6 **Int** +4 **Wis** +8 **Cha** +4 --- **AC** 36 **Fort** +26 **Ref** +24 **Will** +28 **HP** 190 ([fast healing 10](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15), [negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42), one more breath) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [_sleep_](/Spells.aspx?ID=288), [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31) **Resistances** physical 10 (except [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103) [darkwood](/Equipment.aspx?ID=376)) **Jiang-Shi Vulnerabilities**
**Warped Fulu** --- **Speed** 30 feet; rigor mortis **Melee** claw +29 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)), **Damage** 3d10+13 piercing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **Monk Focus Spells** DC 34, 3 Focus Points - **8th** [Ki Rush](/Spells.aspx?ID=485), [Medusa's Wrath](/Spells.aspx?ID=739), [Wind Jump](/Spells.aspx?ID=490) **Drain Qi** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) When Draining Qi, the minister of tumult regains 19 HP. **Premonition of Death** **Trigger** The minister rolls initiative or their turn begins; **Effect** The minister is attuned to coming violence. The minister uses Stance of Death. **Stance of Death** ([Stance](/Traits.aspx?ID=152), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) The minister's qi-engorged form allows perfect body control at all times. They assume one of the following stances.
  • **Bone Corpse** When the minister successfully Drains Qi while in this stance, for 1 round each time the [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10) creature Strides it must succeed at a DC 5 flat check or waste the action and fall [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31).
  • **Cloudless Void** The jiang-shi gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and their claw Strikes gain the [reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192) trait.
  • **Sundered Veins** Creatures struck by the jiang-shi's claw Strikes take 1d10 _persistent bleed damage_. On a critical hit, they are also [enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13).
